FuncDef: The refresh bgp vpn-target command softly resets connections in the BGP-VPN-Target address family. The refresh bgp vpn-target command softly resets connections in the BGP-VPN-Target address family.
CLIs: refresh bgp vpn-target { all | <ipv4-address> | <ipv6-address> | group <group-name> | external | internal } { import | export }
refresh bgp vpn-target { all | <ipv6-address> | group <group-name> | external | internal } { import | export }

ParaDef.Info:
Softly resets all the BGP IPv4 connections.
-

Specifies the IPv4 address of a BGP peer.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
It is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an IPv6 peer address.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the name of a BGP peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

Performs a soft reset on IBGP connections.
-

Softly resets the BGP connections related to VPN-Target.
-
